intro: Satureja atropatana, commonly known as Armenian savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine and cuisine for their pungent, slightly peppery flavor. Satureja atropatana thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments.
